title: Old "Diet Coke" Serif Typeface
content:
Hi,  
I was hoping could help me ID this serif font form an old Diet Coke logo.  
Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317151316im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_nazulgxMEc1qav6sko1_1280_4450.jpg)

Font: 

 Times New Roman 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317151316/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")
author: manifold

comments.content:
Appears to be garden-variety Times New Roman Bold:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/times-new-roman/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317151316/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/times-new-roman/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/times-new-roman/")

Your sample most likely predates the digital type era, so some details (for instance, the angle of the stroke end on the lower curve of the C and the upper serif on the k) won't be a spot-on match.
Thank you! That looks about right. I didn't even think of comparing it to good old Times New Roman.
Whoever set it did a great job of making a text face look good at a display size....
TimesEighteen LT Roman (Bold) from Linotype to be exact.

Well done, Bob (yes, I was just too lazy to cycle through all the iterations of Times):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-eighteen/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317151316/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-eighteen/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-eighteen/")
This solve should go to Bob--I only identified the general family, not the exact font.
